noun.description: Something or someone that one vehemently dislikes.
examples: racial hatred was anathema to her

noun.description: A formal curse by a pope or a council of the Church, excommunicating a person or denouncing a doctrine.

origin: Early 16th century: from ecclesiastical Latin, excommunicated person, excommunication, from Greek anathema thing dedicated, (later) thing devoted to evil, accursed thing, from anatithenai to set up.
